intro: Menyanthes verna, commonly known as spring snowflake, is a small perennial herbaceous plant native to the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped and covered in a fine, waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The genus Menyanthes is part of the family Geraniaceae, which includes other plants with similar floral structures.
